name: You'll Never Walk Alone Quiz | UK Football Teams | 15 Questions

questions.text: When was 'the best team in the world' established?
questions.explanation:
1892.

	Liverpool F.C. came about after Everton left Anfield over issues on the rent they had to pay to Mr John Houlding. Houlding was left with a ground but no team, but not for long. He was fortunate that talented Irishman John McKenna, a member of the Everton coaching staff stayed loyal to him. McKenna set about building Liverpool Football Club. He looked north for talent and assembled a team which became known as 'the team of all the Macs'. The team all hailed from Scotland with the exception of goalkeeper and Englishman, Bill McOwen.

questions.text: From where did Liverpool sign Paddy Berger?
questions.explanation:
Dortmund.

	Roy Evans signed him in 1996 after good displays in the European championships.

questions.text: How many goals did Liverpool score in the 2000-01 season in all competitions?
questions.explanation:
127.

	73 League, 19 UEFA, 18 League Cup (Worthington Cup), and 17 FA Cup. When commenting on this Houlier said 'according to the press 126 of these goals were scored from breakaways from our own box and the other was probably an own goal'.

questions.text: Micheal Owen's date of birth is _____ .
Who did Liverpool defeat to win their first UEFA cup?
questions.explanation:
Monchengladbach.

	1973: Shankly's only European trophy in 15 years of managing the Reds.

questions.text: Liverpool's first European Cup final win came in what year?
questions.explanation:
1977.

	3-1 win over Monchengladbach in Rome. As the celebratory champagne flowed Paisley, later honoured with an OBE, sat quietly in a corner of the team hotel and said: 'I'm not having a drink becacause I want to savour every moment. The Pope and I are two of the few sober people in Rome tonight!'

questions.text: Liverpool won their second European Cup, in the year after their first, against what club?
questions.explanation:
Club Brugge.

	1-0 at Wembley in 1978 (arguably their greatest acheivement on English soil). Dalglish scored the only goal.

questions.text: When did Liverpool win their first Division One title (League Championship)?
questions.explanation:
1901.

	Liverpool captured the League Championship in 1901 under the guidance of Tom Watson. Liverpool were twice Division Two champions in the previous decade: 1893-94 and 1895-96.

questions.text: Who came after Paisley as manager of Liverpool?
questions.explanation:
Fagan.

	Fagan was appointed as Paisley's number two upon the retirement of Shankly in 1974 and was always a quiet and effective worker in the 'bootroom'. However, whilst he had the enormous experience of working under Shankly and Paisley, there was no doubt that he had to make serious managerial decisons immediately upon taking over in 1983. Two years later he resigned as manager after the Hysel Stadium disaster (May 1985) despite leading the club to a League Championship, League Cup and European Cup treble in 1984.

questions.text: How many players scored hat-tricks against The Reds in Europe, during the four decades 1960s to 1990s?
Who scored Liverpool's goal in the 2000-01 UEFA Cup game against Barcelona?
questions.explanation:
Macallister.

	From the penalty spot in the 70th minute after Kluivert hand-balled in the box (semi-final second leg at Anfield). Liverpool won the game and the tie 1-0 and went on to win the final against Alaves 5-4 on the 'golden goal' rule (Macallister provided the deflected winner).

questions.text: What's Igor Biscan's nickname, given to him by his Red teamates?
questions.explanation:
Fonz.

	Because of his leather jacket.

questions.text: When Liverpool won the 2001 FA Cup, how many times had they won the FA Cup, League Cup and League Championship (total)?
questions.explanation:
30.

	18 League Championships, 6 FA Cups, and 6 League Cups. The double in 1986 and two Trebles:1984: League Champions, League Cup and European Cup.2001: FA Cup, League Cup and UEFA Cup.

questions.text: Liverpool beat Manchester United 2-1 in the 2001 Charity Shield. Owen got one, who got the other?
How many goals did Ian Rush, Roger Hunt, Robbie Fowler and Kevin Keegan score between them (in total) in European competition?
questions.explanation:
60.

	Ian Rush got 20 European goals between 1980 and 1996 before moving to Leeds United, Roger Hunt got 17 between 1959 and 1969 (he then went to Bolton Wanderers), Robbie Fowler got 11 between 1992 and 2001 before going to Leeds United, Kevin Keegan got 12 between 1971 and 1977 before leaving for Hamburg.
